steps.title: Investment Definition
steps.content: Investing is the act of allocating resources, usually money, with the expectation of generating income or profit over time.

steps.title: Why People Invest
steps.content: People invest to grow their wealth, beat inflation, and achieve financial goals like retirement or buying a home.

steps.title: Risk and Return
steps.content: All investments involve some level of risk. Generally, higher potential returns come with higher risk.

questions.text: What is the primary goal of investing?
questions.explanation: The primary goal of investing is to grow wealth over time. While keeping money safe is important, investing involves taking calculated risks to achieve higher returns than savings accounts.

questions.text: What is the relationship between risk and return?
options: Higher risk always means higher return
Higher potential returns generally come with higher risk
Lower risk always means higher return
questions.explanation: Generally, investments with higher potential returns come with higher risk. This is a fundamental principle of investing.

steps.title: Stocks
steps.content: Stocks represent ownership in companies. When you buy stock, you own a small part of that company and may receive dividends.

steps.title: Bonds
steps.content: Bonds are loans you give to governments or companies. They pay you interest over time and return your principal at maturity.

steps.title: Mutual Funds and ETFs
steps.content: These funds pool money from many investors to buy a diversified portfolio of stocks, bonds, or other securities.

questions.explanation: Stocks represent ownership in companies. When you buy stock, you become a shareholder and own a small part of that company.
